title: SCHEDULED_TIME | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Returns the timestamp representing the scheduled time of the current alert. Refer to Specifying timestamps based on alert schedules.
TIMESTAMP_LTZ value that represents the scheduled time of the current alert.
This function is defined in the ALERT schema of the SNOWFLAKE database.

To call this function, you must use a role that is granted the
SNOWFLAKE database role ALERT_VIEWER. For example, to call the function as a user
with the role alert_role, execute:
This function can only be called from within an alert.
Refer to Specifying timestamps based on alert schedules.
